bcc.title: BCC Library – Black History Month Films and Documentaries
bcc.description: In honor of Black History Month 2026, the Bronx Community College Library is pleased to share a curated selection of films and documentaries that celebrate Black history and the Black […]

bcc.title: BCC Celebrates Black History Month 2026
bcc.description: The Bronx Community College (BCC) Geospatial Center of the CUNY CREST Institute (BGCCCI) has been awarded a $300,000 research grant from NASA to study climate change drivers in urban areas, with [...]

bcc.title: BCC Names Sabine Rospide, Esq. as Chief Campus Counsel and Labor Designee
bcc.description: Sabine Rospide, Esq., joins Bronx Community College as Executive Counsel & Labor Designee, bringing her experience in higher-education legal affairs, labor relations, and litigation strategy.

bcc.title: BCC Names Andrea Pinnock as the New Interim Vice President of Administration and Finance
bcc.description: Andrea Pinnock expands her leadership role, continuing on the President’s Strategy & Implementation Team while overseeing finance, operations, and campus services, with a focus on fiscal [...]

bcc.title: BCC & Community Partners Hold Laptop Giveaway
bcc.description: As part of a pre-Thanksgiving initiative to expand digital access, BCC partnered with the Knowledge House, AT&T, and BXEDC to distribute free laptops to students.

bcc.title: Homecoming Celebrated Mardi Gras Style with Full Day of Performances, Activities and Campus Spirit
bcc.description: Bronx Community College's Homecoming 2025 brought alumni, current students, and prospective students from three surrounding high schools to campus for a full day of activities leading up to the [...]

bcc.title: Recognizing the Contributions of BCC’s Alumni Staff and Faculty
bcc.description: More than 80 BCC employees who are also alumni gathered in the Gould Memorial Library rotunda for a special luncheon celebrating achievement, connection, and community. President Larry D. [...]

bcc.title: Standing Against Domestic Violence: BCC Launches Emergency Fund at Campus Vigil
bcc.description: BCC held a campus-wide vigil and march to raise awareness of domestic violence, launching a new emergency fund to support students in crisis and honor the memory of alumna Anthonella Contreras Linarez.

baruc.title: AddressHate’s Early Investment Catalyzes Nearly $500,000 in Funding for Baruch College’s Antisemitism Studies Lab
Baruch College Announces Appointment of New Dean of the Weissman School of Arts and Sciences
Baruch Business Students Excel in Real Estate Competitions

ct.description: These spouses are both first-year nursing students.

qc.title: Queens College Choral Society Will Present Duke Ellington’s The Best of the Sacred Concerts in Collaboration with the Louis Armstrong House Museum for Its 85th Annual Winter Concert December 14
U.S. Poet Laureate Arthur Sze Reads at Queens College December 8
qc.description: Queens College Choral Society Will Present Duke Ellington’s The Best of the Sacred Concerts in Collaboration with the Louis Armstrong House Museum for Its 85th Annual Winter Concert December 14

qc.title: Queens College Featured in Season 15 of “The College Tour,” Now Streaming on Amazon Prime Video
Carmen Cotei Appointed Inaugural Dean of the Queens College School of Business
Queens College Posts Latest Viewbooks Online
Advisory: Queens College Ribbon-Cutting to Reopen Renovated Gertz Hall, Which Houses the College’s Prestigious Speech Language Hearing Center
Queens College Hosts Public Reading by Newly Appointed New York State Poet Laureate Kimiko Hahn, CUNY Distinguished Professor at the College
Hispanic Heritage Month Exhibition at Queens College Explores the Quinceañera Coming-of-Age Ceremony Through Fashion and Oral History Soundscapes September 25 – December 18

broklyn.title: Mayor Zohran Mamdani Holds Press Conference at Brooklyn College After Handing Out “Under the Radar” Theater Festival Tickets
broklyn.description: The event highlighted efforts to make the arts more accessible and affordable to all New Yorkers.

broklyn.title: Brooklyn College Transforming Arts Equity Through Performances of “Reconstructing”
broklyn.description: Part of the Under the Radar Festival, the production examines how, in the long aftermath of slavery, history might be navigated together—and how we can move toward a more equitable future.

broklyn.title: President Michelle J. Anderson Joins Chancellor Félix V. Matos Rodríguez to Unveil Dual Enrollment Program to Yeshiva Students
broklyn.description: Visits to Yeshivah of Flatbush Joel Braverman High School showcase a model for future private school partnerships.

broklyn.title: Brooklyn College Celebrates Congresswoman Yvette D. Clarke With Prestigious Presidential Medal of Honor
broklyn.description: President Michelle J. Anderson recognizes Clarke’s enduring service and advocacy for the Brooklyn community and the nation.

broklyn.title: From the President’s Desk: Economic Mobility in the Age of AI
broklyn.description: An Op-Ed on Economic Mobility in the Age of Artificial Intelligence

broklyn.title: Leadership and Career Readiness Take Center Stage at Presidential Lecture Series
broklyn.description: PwC Senior Partner Paul Griggs and Michelle J. Anderson discuss the evolving labor landscape and the skills needed to thrive.

broklyn.title: Uniting for Student Success: Brooklyn College and Aon Explore the Power of Purposeful Partnerships
broklyn.description: In an era shaped by rapid technological change, evolving job markets, and societal disruption, Brooklyn College and global professional services firm Aon are forging innovative pathways to help students thrive in an uncertain future.

broklyn.title: Brooklyn College Named to The Wall Street Journal’s List of America’s Best Colleges for 2026
broklyn.description: Rankings highlight the college’s ability to offer great value and return on investment.

broklyn.title: U.S. News & World Report Ranks Brooklyn College Among Best Colleges
broklyn.description: Senior CUNY campus ranks No. 6 in the North Region for social mobility, highlighting strong student return on investment.

broklyn.title: Brooklyn College to Administer First Doctoral Program
broklyn.description: Transition of Doctor of Audiology program expands the college’s academic reach and strengthens its role as a leader in training the next generation of audiologists.

sph.title: Steep systemic barriers block gay and bisexual men from affirming mental health care
sph.description:
Gay and bisexual men across the U.S. face complex, often discouraging barriers when trying to find affordable, LGBTQ‑affirming mental health care, according to a new study by CUNY SPH researchers.
For this qualitative study, doctoral alumna Alexa D’Angelo, MPH alumna Rifa Ehsan, Associate Profes...

sph.title: New journal section tackles AI, ethics, and digital health communication
sph.description: New York, NY | January 21, 2026: The CUNY Graduate School of Public Health and Health Policy (CUNY SPH) is pleased to announce the launch of AI, Health, and Digital Spaces, a new section of the peer-reviewed Journal of Health Communication, International Perspectives. The section responds to the gro...

sph.title: Bullying tied to higher suicide attempt risk for high school girls
sph.description:
A study by CUNY SPH researchers suggests that U.S. high school students who are bullied at school have substantially higher odds of attempting suicide than peers who are not bullied, with bullied girls facing the greatest risk.
For the study, published in JAMA Open Network, the researchers used 20...

sph.title: Double threat: HIV and hepatitis B co-infection increases risk of kidney dysfunction
sph.description:
A new 10-year regional study led by CUNY SPH doctoral graduate Thinh Toan Vu reveals that adults living with both HIV and hepatitis B virus across the Asia-Pacific face substantially higher risks of kidney dysfunction than those living with HIV alone.
Drawing on data from more than 23,000 adults enr...

sph.title: Welcome Sera Thomas, SRJ Hub social media manager!
sph.description:
CUNY SPH is excited to welcome Sera Thomas to the staff as the social media manager for the Sexual and Reproductive Justice Hub (SRJ Hub).
With experience supporting communications across academic, nonprofit, and healthcare settings, Sera bridges public health knowledge and digital strategy to devel...

sph.title: CUNY SPH alumna Helen Arteaga named deputy mayor for Health and Human Services
sph.description:
CUNY SPH doctoral alumna Helen Arteaga has been appointed deputy mayor for Health and Human Services by New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani.
Dr. Arteaga has served as CEO of NYC Health + Hospitals Elmhurst since 2021, guiding the 545‑bed public facility that became a symbol of the city’s COVID‑...

sph.title: Medicaid psychiatric waivers tied to fewer hospitalizations and incarcerations for people with serious mental illness
sph.description:
Medicaid waivers that relax a long-standing federal funding ban on larger psychiatric hospitals are linked to fewer hospitalizations, emergency visits, and incarcerations among adults with serious mental illness, according to a study led by CUNY SPH Associate Professor Onur Baser.
 Associate Profess...

sph.title: Deborah Levine appointed to New York State Cannabis Education Advisory Panel
sph.description:
Harlem Health Initiative Community Outreach Program Director Deborah Levine, LCSW, is one of 15 experts selected to serve on New York State’s new Cannabis Education Advisory Panel (CEAP).​
In this role, Levine will draw on her public health and social work practice, as well as a deep commitment ...

sph.title: Postdoctoral Fellow Brianna Baker selected for NIH-funded addiction research program
sph.description:
Brianna A. Baker, Ph.D., a postdoctoral fellow at the CUNY SPH Center for Innovation in Mental Health, has been selected as a 2025 Fellow in the NIH-funded Scientific Training in Addiction Research Techniques (START) program.
The highly competitive fellowship provides advanced training, mentorship, ...

sph.title: New research uses meconium to map prenatal metal exposure
sph.description:
Newly published research sheds light on how and where New York’s youngest residents are exposed to environmental metals before they are even born.
Two publications by recent CUNY SPH doctoral graduate Fiona Fogarty, Associate Professor Brian Pavilonis, Professor Suzanne McDermott, and colleagues s...

hostos.title: Inaugural Alumni Newsletter Published January 29
hostos.description: The Office of Alumni Relations is pleased to announce the launch of the very first Hostos Community College Alumni Newsletter. The first issue available here features news and updates for alumni, as well as original articles, poems, and reflections form six alumni.

hostos.title: Foundation Board Directors Invest in Reviving Hostos Alumni Homecoming
hostos.description: On Saturday, September 26, 2026, Hostos Community College will host its first Alumni Homecoming in more than a decade. This once-beloved event fizzled after staff transitions, but two visionary Board members are investing their own capital in reviving the Homecoming as an annual celebration of Hostos’ lifelong impact on its graduates.

hostos.title: All classes will be offered online, January 26th.
hostos.description: All classes will be offered online today, January 26th. If you have an in-person class today, please log into your course in Brightspace for more information about your class. If you have any questions, please email your professor.

hostos.title: Hostos Secures Over $100,000 in CUNY AI Innovation Fund Awards
hostos.description: Hostos Community College has been awarded more than $100,000 in competitive funding from the CUNY AI Innovation Fund, recognizing the College’s leadership in advancing ethical artificial intelligence (AI), innovative pedagogy, and faculty-driven instructional transformation.

hostos.title: Hostos Student NaiAsia McGregor Selected for Prestigious Kaplan Leadership Program
hostos.description: Hostos Community College proudly announces that student NaiAsia McGregor has been selected as a 2025–26 Kaplan Leadership Scholar, a prestigious honor awarded to a highly selective group of exceptional community college students.

hostos.title: Hostos Faculty Celebrate Completion of Rigorous ACUE Effective Online Teaching Practices Certification
hostos.description: Learning never stops at Hostos Community College, including for our dedicated faculty. On Tuesday, December 16, the Office of Academic Affairs (OAA) held a special pinning ceremony celebrating 29 faculty members’ completion of the Association of College and University Educators’ (ACUE) Effective Online Teaching Practices certification course.

hostos.title: Historic Development for Health Equity at Hostos: Steven & Alexandra Cohen Foundation Funds Full Tuition for Nursing Students
hostos.description: Hostos Community College is proud to announce a transformative development for the future of healthcare and our community, made possible by a generous grant of up to $568,000 from the Steven & Alexandra Cohen Foundation.

hostos.title: Community in Verse: Hostos Celebrates Third Annual Peace & Poetry Event
hostos.description: Hostos Community College once again gathered in celebration of unity, reflection, and creative expression at its Third Annual Peace & Poetry event, held on Tuesday, December 9, in a packed Savoy Multipurpose Room.

hostos.title: Latin American Writers Institute Launches 21st Number of “Hostos Review / Revista Hostosiana”
hostos.description: The Latin American Writers Institute (LAWI) at Hostos Community College proudly announces the publication of the 21st edition of Hostos Review / Revista Hostosiana . This multilingual journal continues its long tradition — begun in 2004 — of amplifying contemporary voices from Latin America, the Caribbean, the United States Latina/o/x community, and the broader Ibero-American diaspora.

hostos.title: Hostos’ CUNYTuesday Campaign Raises $57,000 for Vital Student Resources
hostos.description: December 2, 2025 was recognized as GivingTuesday around the world and CUNYTuesday on all 26 CUNY campuses—a day when individuals are asked to remember the causes that matter most amid this busy season of shopping and giving. For Hostos Community College, it was a day filled with joy and gratitude, as our generous faculty, staff, and community of supporters gave more than $57,000 toward resources that encourage persistence and inspire students’ academic success—including emergency scholarships, the campus food pantry, the Center for Arts and Culture, and the Alumni Fund for Student Transfer Scholarships.

hostos.title: Hostos’ Student Government Association Fights Food Insecurity: Makes $900 Gift to Food Pantry for CUNY Tuesday
hostos.description: Giving Tuesday, the International Day of Giving, was developed in 2012 to inspire global philanthropy. At Hostos Community College, where CUNY Tuesday is celebrated on December 2, this generous spirit is alive and well.

hostos.title: Hostos Unites for Annual Thanksgiving Distribution, Supporting Students in Need
hostos.description: The spirit of giving was in full swing at Hostos Community College on Tuesday, November 25, as the College’s One Stop program hosted its annual Thanksgiving Turkey and Chicken Distribution event.

hostos.title: Hostos Welcomes Two-Time Forbes’ Best Chef in America Kelvin Fernández to Empower Students Through Cooking and Conversation
hostos.description: The third annual Nourishing Conversations event at Hostos Community College brought celebrated private chef and two-time Forbes “Best Chef in America” honoree Kelvin Fernández to the Bronx for an evening that blended inspiration, culture, and hands-on culinary guidance.

hostos.title: Hostos Alumna Dr. Paule Valery Joseph Among CUNY Alumni 50 Under 50 Awardees
hostos.description: ​The City University of New York has announced its “50 Under 50” alumni awards, honoring graduates whose leadership, innovation and service exemplify the transformative power of public higher education. Among these standout honorees is one of our own: Dr. Paule Valery Joseph, a Hostos Community College alumna, from the Class of 2005.

hostos.title: Hostos Students Go Behind the Scenes at Sesame Workshop
hostos.description: Nine Hostos Community College students from The Mind Collective (Behavioral Sciences Club) spent an exciting afternoon at Sesame Workshop HQ in Manhattan.

hostos.title: Digital Design & Animation and Arts Administration are the Focus of Hostos’ Seventh Industry Summit
hostos.description: On Thursday, November 11, Hostos Community College convened the seventh in a series of Industry Summits designed to bring together professionals, educators and students to discuss various fields and the career opportunities they represent, how to optimize Hostos curricula to better prepare students for jobs in those fields, and provide tips and insights from those who have already established themselves professionally. This time, the focus was on Digital Design & Animation and Arts Administration.

hostos.title: Hostos Celebrates Science Week with Focus on AI, Student Achievement, and Global Impact of Alumni
hostos.description: Hostos Community College launched its 2025 Science Week on Wednesday, November 12, with a standing-room-only audience in the Hostos Research Center. This year’s theme, “Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Science Discovery,” framed an opening ceremony that blended scientific insight with powerful student and alumni stories, setting an enthusiastic tone for the week’s STEM-focused events.

hostos.title: Hostos Celebrates the Life and Work of Puerto Rican Poet Julia de Burgos with Special Screening of ‘Julia VIVE’
hostos.description: On Wednesday, November 5, Hostos Community College celebrated the spirit of Puerto Rico's beloved national poet, Julia de Burgos, with screenings of the documentary "Julia VIVE."

hostos.title: New Men’s Head Basketball Coach, Kenneth Stevens – Building a Legacy in Basketball and Community
hostos.description: The Caimans’ new Head Men’s Basketball Coach is a familiar face to the Hostos community. After over twelve years with the team as their beloved assistant coach, Coach Kenneth Stevens is taking up the mantle and leading the College’s storied Caimans in the 2025-26 season.

hostos.title: Hostos Welcomes CUNY Chancellor Félix V. Matos Rodríguez Back to Campus for 2025 State of the University Address
hostos.description: Hostos Community College was honored to welcome City University of New York (CUNY) Chancellor Félix V. Matos Rodríguez back to Hostos on Wednesday, October 29, for his 2025 State of the University Address, marking a meaningful homecoming for the former Hostos president.

hostos.title: "Be Bold, Be Engaged”: Hostos Students Receive Inspiring Guidance from Seasoned Higher Ed Leader Dr. Robert A. Scott
hostos.description: On Wednesday, October 22, Hostos Community College proudly hosted Dr. Robert A. Scott, co-author of “Letters to Students: What It Means to Be a College Graduate,” for an inspiring presentation that celebrated the transformative power of higher education, reflection, and purpose-driven learning.

hostos.title: Hostos President, Dr. Daisy Cocco De Filippis, Recognized As a 2025 Power Player in Education by PoliticsNY and amNY
hostos.description: We are proud to announce that Hostos Community College President Daisy Cocco De Filippis, Ph.D, has been recognized as a 2025 Power Player in Education by PoliticsNY and amNY! This exciting news, shared on Wednesday, October 22, highlights the remarkable contributions of leaders in education — ranging from public officials to dedicated advocates — who work tirelessly to ensure New York’s students receive the highest quality education.

hostos.title: Hostos Receives $25,000 Grant from Con Edison to Advance Clean Energy Workforce Training
hostos.description: The Hostos Community College Division of Continuing Education and Workforce Development (CEWD) has been awarded $25,000 by the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc. (Con Edison) to implement the Hostos CEWD Energy Efficiency and Clean Technology Seminar, a program designed to prepare students for education and career pathways in the clean energy and technology sectors.

hostos.title: Hostos Community College and Baruch College Celebrate the Launch of the Hostos-Baruch Business Academy
hostos.description: On Wednesday, October 15, a remarkable milestone was celebrated as Hostos Community College and Baruch College, both distinguished institutions within The City University of New York (CUNY) system, officially launched the Hostos-Baruch Business Academy!

hostos.title: Hostos Recognizes Italian American Heritage with Celebration of Culture, History, and Scholarship
hostos.description: Hostos Community College proudly celebrated Italian American Heritage Month with an afternoon webinar that brought together faculty, students, and special guests to honor the enduring influence of Italian culture and the immigrant experience in America on Wednesday, October 15.

hostos.title: The Beauty of the Bronx Shines at the 19th Annual Hostos Scholarship Fund Golf Outing Classic
hostos.description: The beauty of the Bronx was on full display at Pelham Bay & Split Rock Golf Courses for the Hostos Scholarship Fund Golf Outing Classic on Thursday, October 9. Just over 100 golfers spent a day in the fall sunshine, and the event helped to raise more than $175,000 to support student success at Hostos Community College.

hostos.title: Puerto Rican Artist Kayleen Berry Brings Art, Science, and Heritage Together at Hostos
hostos.description: As part of its Hispanic Heritage Month celebration, Hostos Community College proudly welcomed Puerto Rican artist Kayleen Berry for a special presentation that reflected the College’s mission to connect education, culture, and community while inspiring students to pursue their own creative and professional aspirations. Born in the Bronx and now living between Upstate New York and Aguadilla, Puerto Rico, and the daughter of Hostos Public Safety Officer Raul DeJesus, Berry captivated the audience with a talk that explored the dynamic intersections of art, science, and cultural identity.

hostos.title: With a Caregiver’s Heart, Alicia James Will Go from Hostos to Columbia as the 2025-26 NextGen Public Health Scholar
hostos.description: When Alicia James reads the words “NextGen Public Health Scholar,” she still sometimes has to pause and say them out loud, as if affirming they belong to her.

hostos.title: "Room Enough for Us All”: Hostos Opens Interfaith Room to Honor Diversity of Belief on Campus
hostos.description: On October 1, Hostos Community College marked a historic and heartfelt occasion: the opening of its new Interfaith Room, a space dedicated to honoring the diversity of faith traditions, personal beliefs, and shared humanity that defines the Hostos family.

hostos.title: Hostos Honors Program Students Attend Prestigious 2025 Concordia Summit
hostos.description: Last week, five Hostos Honors Program students had an incredible opportunity to attend the 2025 Concordia Annual Summit at the Sheraton Times Square, which coincided with the United Nations General Assembly.

hostos.title: A Celebration of Care and Culture for Bronx Families at Hostos
hostos.description: On a sunny Sunday afternoon on September 28 in the Bronx, the Hostos Community College’s C-building was transformed into a vibrant festival of music, health, and community spirit for the Hostos-Somos Community Care Fest.

hostos.title: Closing Ceremony Underscores Transformative Impact of 2025 Hostos Study Abroad Program in the Dominican Republic
hostos.description: The Summer 2025 Hostos Community College Professional Development & Study Abroad Program to the Dominican Republic, which took place from June 26 to July 6 , concluded with a celebratory closing reunion at Gregorio Luperón High School on Thursday, September 25, reaffirming the program’s impact on educators across the NYC Department of Education (DOE).

hostos.title: Hostos Highlights the Enduring Legacies of Educational Visionaries Eugenio María de Hostos and Salomé Ureña in Honor of Hispanic Heritage Month
hostos.description: In celebration of Hispanic Heritage Month, Hostos Community College hosted a special bilingual gathering on Thursday, September 18, featuring Sherezada Chiqui Vicioso, renowned poet and playwright, and Dr. Orlando Hernández, professor emeritus and author.

hostos.title: Hostos Community College Celebrates Hispanic Heritage Month with Inspiring Awards Ceremony Honoring Community Leaders and Scholars
hostos.description: Hostos Community College kicked off its 2025 Hispanic/Latinx Heritage Month celebrations on Wednesday, September 17, with a special awards ceremony honoring the exceptional achievements of distinguished Latino leaders and Hostos student scholars.

hostos.title: Packed House, Open Minds: Hostos Constitution Day Puts Democracy in Students’ Hands
hostos.description: Yesterday, Wednesday, September 17, a super-packed crowd filled C-391 for Hostos Community College’s Constitution Day program, a student-centered conversation on constitutional rights, privacy and law enforcement, civic learning from childhood, and the evolving meaning of “Who is an American?”

hostos.title: Hostos President Welcomes City Council Finance Team to Children’s Center
hostos.description: Hostos Community College President Daisy Cocco De Filippis, accompanied by Althea Sterling, Student Development and Enrollment Management Vice President, proudly welcomed NYC Council members and CUNY executives to the cutest corner of the College: the Hostos Children’s Center.

hostos.title: Hostos Community College President Daisy Cocco De Filippis Named Among City & State's 2025 Latino Trailblazers
hostos.description: Hostos Community College is proud to announce that President Daisy Cocco De Filippis has been named one of City & State's 2025 Latino Trailblazers.

hostos.title: Hostos President Daisy Cocco De Filippis Featured in Historic “Voices from CUNY” Podcast Series
hostos.description: Hostos Community College proudly announces that our President, Dr. Daisy Cocco De Filippis, is featured in the newly launched “Voices from CUNY” podcast series. The show is a groundbreaking initiative led by the National Association of Community College Teacher Education Programs (NACCTEP), an organization that promotes community colleges' role in the recruitment, preparation, retention, and renewal of diverse PreK-12 educators.

hostos.title: Hostos Dean Carlos Rivera Selected as HACU Leadership Academy Fellow
hostos.description: Hostos Community College is pleased to share that Carlos Rivera, Interim Associate Dean of Student Development and Enrollment Management (SDEM) and Director of Admissions and Recruitment, is among the 26 fellows selected for the Hispanic Association of Colleges and Universities' (HACU) seventh cohort of its Leadership Academy/La Academia de Liderazgo .

hostos.title: Hostos Community College Expands its Campus into the Historic Bronx General Post Office Building
hostos.description: On September 3, Hostos Community College unveiled a major expansion of its campus in the South Bronx. Hostos President Dr. Daisy Cocco De Filippis was delighted to welcome NYC Mayor Eric Adams, CUNY Chancellor Félix V. Matos Rodríguez, Council Member Rafael Salamanca and other VIPs to celebrate that the College will be moving into the historic Bronx General Post Office Building to grow its highly successful Allied Health and Nursing programs, create additional labs for its Natural Sciences courses and support the creation of new academic programs.

hostos.title: Fall Semester Kicks Off with Annual BBQ
hostos.description: The smoky aroma of the grill drifted down the Grand Concourse, mixing with music beats and the chatter of faculty, staff, and students. Their voices carried across Evelina Antonetty Playground on Thursday, August 28, when Hostos’ Division of  Student Development and Enrollment Management (SDEM) turned the sunny end-of-summer afternoon into a full-on block party vibe with the annual Start of Fall BBQ.

hostos.title: Hostos Students to Benefit from Bold New Initiatives Powered by the Ms. MacKenzie Scott’s Gift
hostos.description: Hostos Community College is pleased to announce the 2025-26 Ms. MacKenzie Scott’s Gift: President’s Initiatives Winning Proposals: “See It, Believe It, Achieve It,” “ONLN Peer Assistant Learning Scholars (PALS),” and “Transfer and Career Pathways in LLAC Studies: Establishing a Mentored Student Cohort.”

hostos.title: Hostos Department of Public Safety Honored with Professional Development FBI Award
hostos.description: Hostos Community College is proud to announce that its Department of Public Safety was awarded the prestigious Agency Trilogy Award from the FBI Law Enforcement Executive Development Association (FBI-LEEDA) on Monday, August 25.

hostos.title: Hostos Professor Linda Hirsch Named Distinguished Fellow by the Association for Writing Across the Curriculum
hostos.description: Hostos Community College is thrilled to share that Dr. Linda Hirsch, Ph.D., has been recognized as a Distinguished Fellow by the Association for Writing Across the Curriculum (AWAC). She is the first CUNY WAC coordinator to ever receive this accolade.

hostos.title: High School Entrepreneurs Present Business Plans in Hostos College Now Program
hostos.description: This summer, Hostos College Now piloted a new program called CareerReady/CUNY Reach in partnership with the Laboratory School for Finance and Technology (LFT).  Twenty-eight high school students took the BUS 240 (Entrepreneurship) class at Hostos Community College in the morning, stayed for lunch provided by the cafeteria, and then, in the afternoons, worked at internships on campus that supported the work of the college course.

hostos.title: CUNY Executive Vice Chancellor Hector Batista  Gives a Surprise Concert at Hostos
hostos.description: On August 12, as the bright sun streamed in through the windows of the A-Atrium at Hostos Community College, the irresistible rhythms of a salsa band pulled faculty, staff and students onto the floor to dance. The percussionist propelling the band was none other than CUNY’s Executive Vice Chancellor and Chief Operating Officer Hector Batista who had come to Hostos to fulfill a promise to President Daisy Cocco De Filippis: to come play for her at the College.

hostos.title: Hostos Community College’s Dean Ana García Reyes Honored at NYC Dominican Flag Raising Ceremony
hostos.description: The Dominican flag waved proudly over Bowling Green on Monday, August 11, as Ana García Reyes, Hostos Community College’s Dean of Community Relations, was honored during the City of New York’s Fourth Annual Dominican Flag Raising Ceremony in Lower Manhattan.

hostos.title: Hostos Celebrates Dominican Pride Week at 43rd National Dominican Day Parade and More
hostos.description: Hostos Community College proudly joined the citywide celebration of Dominican culture and heritage during Dominican Pride Week, with a strong presence at the 43rd National Dominican Day Parade on Sunday, August 10, and several affiliated events.

hostos.title: HOPE at Hostos: Hostos' Holistic Oasis for Parents’ Education Program Celebrates (HOPE)  2025 Scholars in Inspiring Ceremony and Showcase
hostos.description: On Thursday, July 24, Hostos Community College's Holistic Oasis for Parents' Education (HOPE) program concluded its summer session with an exciting showcase and completion ceremony, led by Mistress of Ceremonies Leyla Caballero, a 2025 HOPE alumna and research assistant.

hostos.title: Hostos Delegation Participates in NYC-Dominican Republic Academic Exchange
hostos.description: From June 26 to July 6, a diverse delegation of teachers, school principals, college professors, and administrators from Hostos Community College (CUNY) and the New York City Department of Education participated in an intensive academic and cultural exchange program in the Dominican Republic, co-coordinated with the Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD), the first university in the Americas.

york.title: Professor Vu Presents New Research on Mental Health Disparities
york.description: Dr. Thinh Toan Vu, adjunct assistant professor, who teaches Foundation of Health and Well-being in the Department of Health and Human Performance, presented three research studies at the 2025 American Public Health Association Annual Meeting & Expo in Washington, D.C.

york.title: New Doc by Former Colleagues Explores Asian Americans' Growing Political Leadership
york.description: Two Asian American professors with ties to York College have collaborated on a timely and engaging new documentary examining the growing political influence of Asian Americans.

york.title: Music Professor Rocks His Academic Discipline
york.description: Dr. Thomas Zlabinger, associate professor of music, is among York’s busiest and most accomplished faculty members. In addition to his teaching responsibilities over the past three semesters, Dr. Zlabinger has maintained a jam-packed schedule of professional leadership, scholarly activity, and creative engagement.

york.title: Campus Play Brings Warmth with 'Jaja's African Hair Braiding'
york.description: Anyone who has ever spent time in a New York City hair salon knows it is a world unto itself --full of conversation, laughter, storytelling, and shared experience.

york.title: CUNY and Weill Cornell Researchers Validate First Hindi Tool to Diagnose Prolonged Grief Disorder
york.description: Groundbreaking collaboration brings culturally sensitive grief assessment to Hindi-speaking communities.

york.title: Library Closed for Lincoln's Birthday
york.description: The Library will be closed on Thursday, Feb. 12, 2026, in observance of the Lincoln's birthday holiday.

york.title: Gov. Hochul Visits York Child Care Center to Promote Universal Childcare Proposal
york.description: Youngsters at the York College Child and Family Center, Inc. received a special treat on Thursday (January 15) when New York State Governor Kathy Hochul visited to tour the center, engage with the children, and highlight her proposal for universal childcare.

york.title: Aviation Professor Publishes Paper in Prestigious Journal
york.description: Assistant Professor Billy Metallinos has published a new scholarly article in the field of aviation safety titled “Understanding How Collaborative Communication and Competence-Based Educational Training…”

york.title: Mondell Sealy Honored as Employee of the Month for December
york.description: Mondell Sealy is synonymous with dedication, creativity, and an unwavering passion for connecting York students with internships and career opportunities. In recognition of her outstanding contributions, she was recently named Employee of the Month for December 2025.

york.title: Students Attend Deloitte Future Accounting Leaders Summit in Texas
york.description: Twenty-three first- and second-year York students majoring in accounting attended the Future Accounting Leaders Summit, held at Deloitte University in Westlake, Texas, and hosted by Deloitte*.

york.title: York College Advances University-Wide Collaboration Through CUNY Inclusive Sports Initiative
york.description: York College took part in a CUNY Inclusive and Adaptive Sports event on Friday hosted with our sister institution, Queens College, demonstrating the College’s ongoing commitment to equity, access, and student success.

york.title: 2026-2027 FAFSA and TAP Applications
york.description: Early filing keeps you smiling

york.title: Financial Aid Day Combines Facts and Fun for Students
york.description: Cheryl Morrison, interim director of Student Financial Services, hosted a Financial Aid Awareness Day last semester to help students better understand the process of applying for and receiving student loans and grants.

york.title: Teacher Ed’s MakerSpace: Where Future Teachers and Young Learners Become Makers
york.description: MakerSpace, the latest technological update in Teacher Education has made Room 1E05, one of the most exciting spaces in Teacher Education -- a place where creativity, technology, and hands-on learning come together.

york.title: Kwanzaa Celebration Brings Seasonal Joy to Campus
york.description: In mid-December, the Africana Studies Center brought warmth, rhythm, and cultural pride to campus with its annual pre-Kwanzaa celebration, welcoming a vibrant cross-section of the college community.

york.title: Environmental Science Professor Shares Expertise Beyond York
york.description: This semester, Dr. Dawn Roberts-Semple, an environmental science professor at York College, participated in a six-person panel discussion where she shared the ways she connects students to environmental science research and related career pathways.

york.title: York Alumna and Professor Completes PhD Program in PA Studies
york.description: Kudos to Physician Assistant (PA) professor and York alumna Jeanetta Yuan, who recently completed a PhD in Curriculum and Instruction from Liberty University, following her Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies at Stony Brook University, with a focus on curriculum and instruction.

york.title: Withum Partners Engage York Students in Professional Development Clinic
york.description: The Department of Accounting and Finance recently welcomed Nadia Matthie, partner at Withum, one of the nation’s top 20 accounting firms, along with Jesse Shearer, Withum’s campus recruiter, for a day of professional development and networking with York College students.

york.title: York College Achieves Initial Accreditation from ACBSP
york.description: The College announced that it has been granted initial accreditation by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs for its Department of Business and Economics.

york.title: Third Party Comment - Upcoming Accreditation
york.description: The Department of Education at York College, CUNY is hosting an accreditation visit by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) from April 15th , 2026, to April 17th , 2026 . Interested parties are invited to submit third-party comments to the evaluation team. Please note that comments must address substantive matters related to the quality of professional education programs offered, and should specify the party’s relationship to the provider (i.e., graduate, present or former faculty member, employer of graduates).

sps.title: U.S. News Ranks CUNY SPS #9 in the Nation for Best Online Bachelor’s
sps.description: In additional top-ten rankings, CUNY SPS is also named #4 in the nation on the publisher's list of Best Online Bachelor's for Veterans, and its BA in Psychology is ranked #7 in the nation on their Best Online Bachelor's in Psychology list.

sps.title: CUNY SPS MAAT Alum Wins Thesis Project Award

sps.title: CUNY SPS Offers Grocery Micro-Grants to Combat Food Insecurity

sps.title: CUNY SPS Community Memorializes Life of Beloved Academic Director

macaly.title: Macaulay Alums Recognized in CUNY's 50 Under 50 List
macaly.description: Macaulay Honors College is thrilled to share that Munazza Alam '16 (Hunter College), Ethan Frisch '08 (City College of New York), and Davi Santos '16 (Lehman College) have been named in CUNY's second annual 50 Under 50 alumni awards listing.

macaly.title: Support Innovative Honors Education
macaly.description: This giving season, join us in providing general support to Macaulay students with a gift of any amount.

macaly.title: Celebrating Macaulay's Alumni Pioneers
macaly.description: Sohail Mathur '10 (Hunter) has been selected as the 2025 Pioneer Alumni Award Winner. He accepted the award at the 2025 Alumni Homecoming celebration where Gary Berenshteyn '05 (Baruch) was also honored with the Dean's Recognition Award.

macaly.title: Marking 25 Years of Excellence, Macaulay Honors Dean Emeritus Ann Kirschner
macaly.description: As Macaulay marks its 25th anniversary, the community gathered to honor a decade of leadership and vision.

macaly.title: Macaulay Wellness Symposium
macaly.description: The Collaborative Wellness Project invites the community to join for the second annual Macaulay Wellness Symposium! This is a day-long event for students, staff, and faculty to come together to learn, discuss, share resources, and gain tools for supporting personal and community wellness.

macaly.title: Meet the Civic Futures Lab Fellows
macaly.description: Macaulay Honors College and Design for America are pleased to introduce the 2025-2026 Macaulay Honors College Civic Futures Lab Fellows, a group of emerging leaders who will take on New York City’s most pressing civic challenges.

macaly.title: Students Tackle Traffic Congestion in 2025 Datathon
macaly.description: Macaulay Honors College hosted the culminating event of its annual Datathon, a competitive event that attracted more than 300 students.

macaly.title: An Eventful Weekend of Discovery
macaly.description: Hundreds of Macaulay Honors College students turned Brooklyn Bridge Park into a living laboratory during the 2025 BioBlitz, held September 13–14. Working alongside scientists and faculty, students collected and cataloged data on the park’s thriving urban ecosystem—identifying hundreds of species and even adding new ones to the public scientific record.

macaly.title: Carmen Boullosa Wins 2025 Premio Nacional Enrique Anderson Imbert
macaly.description: The Academia Norteamericana de la Lengua Española (ANLE) has awarded the 2025 Premio Nacional Enrique Anderson Imbert to Distinguished LecturerCarmen Boullosa, an internationally celebrated novelist, poet, and playwright. Boullosa accepted the award during a special ceremony at the Second Conference on Hispanism in the United States, taking place at the Cervantes Institute in New York City.

macaly.title: Macaulay Announces 2025–2026 Kenan Scholars Cohort
macaly.description: Macaulay introduces the 2025–2026 cohort of Kenan Scholars—a dynamic group of students who will bring passion, creativity, and determination to the challenge of creating a more just and equitable New York City.

ccny.title: CCNY opens Upper Manhattan Small Business Development Center to aid aspiring entrepreneurs
ccny.description: The City College of New York has partnered with the New York Small Business Development Centers to open a regional center at CCNY to encourage entrepreneurship and the creation of small businesses by the members of the CCNY community, as well as entrepreneurs and small businesses throughout Upper Manhattan. This will be the fifth CUNY campus to host a regional center, joining Baruch College, York College, the College of Staten Island, and LaGuardia Community College. The center will be located in Shepard Hall and managed by the Office of Institutional Advancement, Communications, & External

ccny.title: CCNY celebrates Black History Month with wide-ranging events led by Black Studies Department
ccny.description: An exhilarating and wide-ranging variety of events are available almost daily in the month of February to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Black History Month at The City College of New York led by the Black Studies Department. The following events are open to the public. The Harlem Chamber Players, in partnership with the Leonard Davis Center for the Performing Arts at City College, and in association with the Harlem School of the Arts presents the 18th Annual Black History Month Celebration “American Landscapes” on Thursday, Feb. 5 at 7 p.m. at Aaron Davis Hall, 129 Convent Avenue, New

ccny.title: CCNY community celebrates the holidays
ccny.description: The City College of New York's and the Foundation for City College's ongoing outreach initiatives to provide fresh, nutritious meals to those in need continues to expand, including a massive effort that resulted in hundreds of meals being distributed the week of Thanksgiving and again the last week of 2025. Every year since 2020, the College and the Foundation have partnered with Black-owned school food management company Red Rabbit to deliver the meals to different community partners, including PSS Manhattanville Center, Wilson Major Morris Community Center, Greater File Chapel Baptist Church

ccny.title: World enters era of  “Global Water Bankruptcy,” declares UN report led by CCNY's Kaveh Madani
ccny.description: For decades, the world has been warned of a looming water crisis. A landmark report released today at the United Nations Headquarters argues that the time for "crisis management" has passed. The report, Global Water Bankruptcy: Living Beyond Our Hydrological Means in the Post-Crisis Era, is the outcome of an investigation led by Kaveh Madani, the renowned environmental scientist and Research Professor at The City College of New York’s CUNY CREST Institute. The study concludes that humanity has entered a state of “ Global Water Bankruptcy”—a permanent, systemic failure where the natural capital

ccny.title: CCNY undergrads produce five-star performance at annual national STEM conference
ccny.description: Five City College of New York undergraduates from the Division of Science were winners at the Annual Biomedical Research Conference for Minoritized Scientists (ABRCMS) in San Antonio, Texas. The conference attracted close to 5,000 participants – including graduate students, researchers, scientists and exhibitors. Following are details about CCNY’s triumphant ABRCMS quintet, their majors, subject matter and project titles: Litsi Auquilla, junior, biomedical science; social and behavioral sciences and public health, “Comparing Environmental and Clinical Characteristics of Lung Cancer Across New

ccny.title: Three CCNY students take top prize at the FRAME FORWARD Student Video Festival
ccny.description: Three students from The City College of New York are winners of the inaugural FRAME FORWARD Student Video Festival from the Division of Interdisciplinary Studies at the Center for Worker Education. The festival is open to all CUNY students, regardless of their major, with this year’s theme: “Featuring Student Life Through the Eyes of Those Living It.” The festival was founded by Juan Carlos Mercado, dean of the Division of Interdisciplinary Studies, and Lorena De Miranda Marques, academic advisor, marketing and communications, recruitment coordinator at CWE. All winners received a trophy and

ccny.title: CCNY Spitzer student Dayanara Rodriguez received a 2025 AIA Bronx Student Empowerment Award
ccny.description: Dayanara Rodriguez, a M Arch ’26 student in the Bernard and Anne Spitzer School of Architecture at The City College of New York, is a 2025 AIA Bronx Student Empowerment Award winner. She received a $1,000 scholarship and was honored at the awards ceremony along with other students for their participation in the Bronx Reimagined Design Challenge, a competition dedicated to transforming abandoned buildings in the Bronx into spaces that positively impact the surrounding community. “We are incredibly proud of Dayanara Rodriguez for receiving the 2025 Bronx AIA Empowerment Scholarship,” said

ccny.title: Anonymous Was A Woman (AWAW) and New York Foundation for the Arts (NYFA) Announce 2025 Environmental Art Grants Recipients
ccny.description: The Division of Humanities and the Arts at The City College of New York has an abundance of good news to share from its faculty. Writer and Professor Emily Raboteau (“ Lessons for Survival: Mothering Against ‘the Apocalypse’”) received a 2025 Environmental Arts Grant from the New York Foundation for the Arts and Anonymous Was a Woman. The grant supports environmental art projects led by women-identifying artists from the United States and U.S. territories. Raboteau, a professor of Black Studies, was awarded $20,000 for her project, “Voices from the Cross-Bronx Expressway.” Her book-length

ccny.title: Spitzer Architecture School earns Independent Project grants
ccny.description: Two faculty members and one graduate student of the Bernard and Anne Spitzer School of Architecture at The City College of New York have received 2025 Independent Projects grants from the New York State Council on the Arts in conjunction with the Architectural League of New York. Each $10,000 award was granted for a self-generated year-long project in design practice and research that sought to answer the question of where design can go next. In the 2025 cycle, 25 proposals were selected out of 176 applications by a panel of 12 designers and educators. The CCNY grant recipients are: Assistant

ccny.title: Former Ambassador Marc Ostfield is the new Colin Powell School Dean
ccny.description: Executive, scholar, educator and diplomat are all titles that describe Marc Ostfield, who becomes the Richard J. Henley and Susan L. Davis Dean of the Colin Powell School for Civic and Global Leadership at The City College of New York on Jan. 26, 2026. Identified through a search process that drew more than 100 applicants from across the country, Ostfield spent more than two decades in government service, including serving as the U.S. ambassador to the Republic of Paraguay from January 2022 to January 2025. As the chief diplomatic representative of the U.S. government to this South American

hunter.description: Six Hunter students chosen in this round of U.S. Department of State’s Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship.

kbcc.title: NEH Awards $200K to KCC Professor
kbcc.description: Sara Rutkowski was awarded an NEH to develop curricula exploring America’s story through the FWP.

kbcc.title: Inspiring Next-Gen Scientists
kbcc.description: KCC welcomed New York State Assembly Members Jamie Williams and Monique Chandler-Waterman for a firsthand look at Youth Engagement Summer STEM at Sea! (YESSS!)

kbcc.title: 28 New Doulas Graduate at Kingsborough
kbcc.description: Kingsborough Community College honored 28 graduates of its Maternal Health and Doula Training program at a ceremony Aug. 11, 2025.

kbcc.title: KCC’s Future Scientists Take the Spotlight at the 2025 CRSP Symposium
kbcc.description: Three KCC students receive top awards at this year's CRSP/CIRE Symposium.

kbcc.title: Kingsborough Community College Celebrates 60th Commencement
kbcc.description: Kingsborough Community College marked its 60th commencement at the Coney Island Amphitheater on June 18, 2025.

kbcc.title: Santiago Burgos Ramos  Scores Second National Esports Title
kbcc.description: Santiago Burgos Ramos Kingsborough Community College student, has become one of the top collegiate EA FC 25 players in the country.

kbcc.title: Liberal arts major Steven Lakhter has been named KCC’s Class of 2025 salutatorian
kbcc.description: “With every serve and every match, I proved that passion and perseverance were what mattered most.”

kbcc.title: Physical education major Andres Soto has been named KCC’s Class of 2025 valedictorian
kbcc.description: “Where others see a certificate, I see hard work, dedication, and the chance to finally make my family proud.”

kbcc.title: Two Kingsborough Community College Awarded  JKC National Community College Transfer Scholarships
kbcc.description: Kingsborough Community College students Tanzeela Jahangir Chaudhry and William (Liam) Lotz, recipients of the 2025 Jack Kent Cooke Foundation’s Undergraduate Transfer Scholarship.

kbcc.title: CUNY Appoints Suri Duitch as Eighth President of Kingsborough Community College
kbcc.description: The City University of New York has appointed Suri Duitch as president of Kingsborough Community College, making permanent the post she has held on an interim basis since January 2024.

slu.title: Return to In-Person Instruction and Campus Operations, Tues. Jan. 27, 2026
slu.description: January 26, 2025 Dear SLU Community, The CUNY School of Labor and Urban Studies will resume regular on-campus operations and in-person classes on Tuesday, January 27, 2026. Administrative offices, campus services, and all in-person classes will resume as scheduled. Please allow for extra travel time when planning your commute and use caution when traveling to campus. Students should continue to monitor Brightspace and their SLU email for any course-specific communications from instructors. We look forward to welcoming everyone back to campus as we embark upon the Spring semester. Sincerely, Burt and Kiki

slu.title: Weather Alert – Winter Storm Update
slu.description: January 25, 2025 ———————————— Update: Return to In-Person Instruction and Campus Operations, Tues. Jan. 27, 2026 ———————————— Dear SLU Community, Due to severe winter weather conditions, the SLU campus will operate fully remotely on Monday, January 26, 2026. All classes and administrative operations will be conducted remotely, and all on-campus events are canceled. We anticipate returning to on-campus operations on Tuesday, January 27, 2026. Faculty and staff should continue to monitor their email and the SLU website for further updates. Students should check with their Monday instructors for further details and monitor Brightspace for official course communications. Please be safe. […]

slu.title: Transforming Trash and Telling Stories: SLU Grads Make Their Mark
slu.description: A garbage innovator and a budding journalist: Joshua Goodman and Paige Oamek are both SLU graduates who were spotlighted recently in CUNY’s second annual 50 Under 50 Alumni Awards.

slu.title: From Fresh Goals to Job Offers: Internship Program Spurs Careers
slu.description: For some of SLU’s experiential learners, this fall’s internship was the first time they ever used an office phone. For others, it was their first time in an office, period.

slu.title: A Year of Critical Questions and Bold Answers
slu.description: SLU served as a vital academic hub and practical “laboratory” for scholars and students to engage in critical teaching and research over the past year.

slu.title: Major Labor Schools Coming to SLU This Summer
slu.description: Two major labor movement summer schools will be held at SLU in summer 2026—one as a new permanent program and the other as a cyclical hosting event.

slu.title: SLU Student Mohammad ‘Tipu’ Sultan Recognized as ‘Unsung Hero’
slu.description: A drivers’ advocate and former taxi driver, SLU student Mohammad “Tipu” Sultan has been named one of “The 2025 Unsung Heroes” by City & State New York. Sultan is a Labor Studies bachelor’s student and recent recipient of SLU’s Joseph S. Murphy Scholarship for Diversity in Labor.

slu.title: Alumni Joshua Goodman and Paige Oamek Honored by CUNY’s “50 Under 50”
slu.description: SLU alum Joshua Goodman (Urban Studies M.A. Fall 2023), is featured on CUNY’s second annual 50 Under 50 Alumni Awards list. Goodman is Deputy Commissioner for Public Affairs and Customer Experience at the New York City Department of Sanitation, and credits SLU with inspiring his work.

slu.title: Christina Sparrock: Purposefully Driving Person-Centered Mental Health Policy
slu.description: How police should engage with people suffering from mental health conditions is a complex policy question that New York City has grappled with for decades. Due in part to the efforts of SLU master’s student Christina Sparrock, however, one piece of that puzzle was recently resolved.

slu.title: New Professors at SLU
slu.description: The SLU Urban Studies faculty added two new members this fall, with the arrival of Assistant Professor Samantha Agarwal and Distinguished Lecturer Puya Gerami. They both will specialize in the Leadership for Democracy and Social Justice program.

soj.description: This group of 24 journalists, technologists, product managers, designers and data practitioners from around the world will focus on the practical work of building, testing and implementing AI-powered tools inside newsrooms.
